documents.title: dow and s & p rise
text: the dow jones and s & p 500 indexes advanced on thursday to halt a two-session losing skid , buoyed by gains in industrial and energy shares .
the dow jones rose 164.7 points , or 0.66 % , to 24,962.4 , the s & p 500 gained 2.63 points , or 0.10 % , to 2,703.9 , and the nasdaq dropped 8.14 points , or 0.11 , to 7,210.09 .

industrial shares climbed 0.59 % , led by a 3 % gain in quanta services after its quarterly results , and a 3.34 % rise in united technologies after the aero parts maker said it is exploring a breakup of its business portfolio .
energy stocks , up 1.08 % , also helped support gains , as oil prices advanced .

documents.title: blow for dyson in eu vacuum cleaner case
text: a top european court advisor has rejected a complaint by british vacuum cleaner firm dyson that eu energy labels underplay the efficiency of its bagless devices .
dyson says the eu 's energy efficiency labels fail to recognise that ordinary cleaners become less energy efficient as their bags become clogged with dust , unlike the company 's bagless cleaner .
in a separate case , dyson has challenged the labelling system itself .
advocate general henrik saugmandsgaard oe was giving an initial opinion as part of that process .
he said eu law made the energy label compulsory and also set out its format and the information to be included in it .
the methodology of the test was not part of that information .
he concluded that eu law precluded the use of supplementary labels on energy efficiency as these would undermine the aim of the law - to standardise information for consumers .

documents.title: bud and breakfast
text: a marijuana entrepreneur is pulling in more than $ 1m per year with his `` bud and breakfast '' hotel in colorado , says business insider .
the drug is legal to possess in the us state for people over 21 years old .
joel schneider 's innovation is providing a space to smoke/ingest it - most hotels ban the drug .
rooms cost between $ 300 and $ 400 per night , and include breakfasts of bacon , eggs , waffles , and weed , the article says .

documents.title: volkswagen 'a disgrace ' says mp
text: an environment minister has said volkswagen should `` hang their heads in shame '' for the company 's role in tests where humans and monkeys inhaled diesel fumes for hours .
therese coffey told mps the tests were `` disgusting '' , adding that volkswagen 's role in cheating emissions tests was `` a disgrace '' .
volkswagen launched an inquiry last month when it was reported that it was one of three car manufacturers funding scientific tests in which monkeys and humans were exposed to diesel fumes .

documents.title: booze cruise ? think again
text: uk drivers licences may not be recognised by the eu after brexit , the daily telegraph reports .
british vehicle registration documents and certificates of professional competence may also become invalid in the eu .
the result could be that travellers would be unable to hire cars or take out insurance .
the warning was issued in presentation slides released by the european commission today , the daily telegraph article says .
the department for transport says ministers are confident '' a deal will be agreed and that the government has already begun taking steps to mitigate the impact if discussions fail .
plan b is signing up to the united nations convention on road traffic .
it allows drivers to apply for an international driving permit .
that document would enable uk drivers to drive in the eu .
but its more paperwork and more cost , and it 's a paper-based system .
the rac and aa charge £ 5.50 for it .
author: Victoria Fritz
BBC transport correspondent

documents.title: mexico turns to brazilian grain
text: mexican buyers imported ten times more corn from brazil last year amid concern that nafta renegotiations could disrupt their us supplies , a reuters analysis of government data and grain merchants finds .

mexico is on track to buy more brazilian corn in 2018 , which could have an impact on a us agricultural sector already struggling with low grain prices and the rising competitive threat from south america .

documents.title: phoenix 'in talks to buy standard life aberdeen unit for £ 3bn '
text: phoenix group holdings is in talks to buy standard life aberdeen 's insurance business for about £ 3bn , reuters reports .
the deal for the unit could be announced as soon as friday , when standard life aberdeen ( sla ) publishes its first set of annual results .
insurer phoenix would fund the transaction with a rights issue of about £ 1bn , reuters says .

documents.title: elon musk quits ai ethics research group
text: technology billionaire elon musk has quit the board of the research group he co-founded to look into the ethics of artificial intelligence .
in a blog post , openai said the decision had been taken to avoid any conflict of interest as mr musk 's electric car company , tesla , became `` more focused on ai '' .
he has been one of ai 's most vocal critics , stressing the potential harms .
mr musk will continue to donate to and advise the group .

documents.title: universities 'making money from strikes '
text: a fascinating post from the financial times alphaville blog .
due to the economics of tuition fees and the employment of lecturers , universities could actually be making money from widespread staff strikes over pensions , the article says .
pay is docked from striking lecturers , but students are not reimbursed fees .
neat , eh ?
everyone 's a winner , apart from the staff and the students .

documents.title: kfc shortage : how much do we spend on fried chicken ?
text: kfc outlets across the uk have closed temporarily this week as delivery problems led to a shortage of chicken .
the fried chicken chain switched its delivery contract last week to dhl , which blamed `` operational issues '' for the disruption .
nearly half of the restaurant 's 900 outlets were closed on tuesday night - down from 575 on monday .
the fast food giant expects disruption to its restaurants to continue for the rest of the week .
read more here .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: snap shares sink after redesign and jenner tweet
text: snap shares have sunk about 7 % in the third session of losses in a row after a poorly received redesign for snapchat .
the redesign , which separated `` friends '' from content feeds , did not impress some users , including snap `` influencer '' kylie jenner , the half-sister of celebrity kim kardashian .
on wednesday , ms jenner - who has almost 25 million twitter followers - tweeted : `` sooo does anyone else not open snapchat anymore ?
or is it just me ugh this is so sad . ''
summit insights group analyst jonathan kees says : `` she 's one of the snapchat divas it 's not good if one of the main symbols for your app says 'i 'm not going to use the app ' '' -

documents.title: airbnb looks to luxury holidays and hotels for growth
text: airbnb is rolling out new services aimed at attracting travelers looking for luxury accommodations and traditional hotels , the latest move to contend with sputtering growth in its original home-renting business .

regulators in key cities such as berlin , london , new york and san francisco , its home town , have cracked down on short-term rentals , blaming airbnb for exacerbating already tight housing markets .
the company has been forced to slash its listings in certain popular cities as part of its concessions to regulators .

documents.title: barclays ' gender pay gap 'shocking ' says morgan
text: the gender pay gap at barclays is `` shocking '' , says treasury chair nicky morgan .
`` on average , women at barclays international are paid half as much as men .
for this to be the case in 2018 is shocking , '' she says .
`` barclays has signed up to the women in finance charter , which commits signatories to supporting the progression of women into senior roles in the financial services sector .
`` one way of reducing the gender pay gap is to increase the proportion of women in more senior roles , so it appears that barclays is on the right track . ''

documents.title: eu shadow-boxing towards brexit
text: there is much political posturing but still a lack of detail in the brexit talks , katya adler reports .

documents.title: tech giants face new uk tax clampdown
text: some of the world 's largest technology firms are facing hefty new bills as the uk government moves to fundamentally change the way they are taxed .
google and facebook are braced for significant changes in the tax system after the treasury told the bbc that a new tax on revenues was the `` potentially preferred option '' .
it would open up the firms ' huge uk sales numbers to the tax authorities .
at the moment , tax is levied on profits , a much smaller figure .
read more here .

documents.title: may holds crunch brexit talks at chequers
text: theresa may and her senior ministers are meeting at the pm 's country retreat in the latest attempt to settle the government 's approach to brexit .
the group of 11 are at chequers to decide how closely the eu and uk should align after exit day in march 2019 .

documents.title: snap chief gets $ 638m pay for float year
text: snap chief executive officer evan spiegel received $ 637.8m total compensation during 2017 , the year the company went public , according to an sec filing .
the figure is based on stock-based awards worth $ 636.6m and salary and other compensation worth about $ 1.2m .

documents.title: ford names kumar galhotra as north america chief
text: giant us car maker ford has appointed company insider kumar galhotra as president for its north america business , filling the gap left by the abrupt departure of raj nair on wednesday after an internal investigation .
mr galhotra has worked for ford for 29 years and previously led its luxury lincoln motor company arm .
he will report to jim farley , ford executive vice president and president of global markets .
the appointment will be be effective from 1 march .
ford said on wednesday that mr nair was leaving the company immediately after an investigation found his behaviour was `` inconsistent with the company 's code of conduct . ''
it did not give any details on what that behaviour was .
a company spokesman said the review was launched in the past few weeks after ford received a report of inappropriate behaviour .
mr galhotra , who has also been ford 's chief marketing officer since last year , will take charge of a business that generates about 90 % of ford 's global profits .

documents.title: flybe shares take off as stobart weighs up takeover bid
text: shares in flybe have soared by more than a quarter after the owner of london southend airport said it was weighing up a potential swoop for the regional airline .
flybe was up about 26 % in afternoon trading on the london stock exchange .
stobart group is looking at `` alternative structures '' for its airline and leasing business .
the company , which spans infrastructure , energy and aviation , said one option was to take a `` non-controlling interest in a vehicle to acquire 100 % of flybe '' .

documents.title: women at barclays earn 43.5 % less than men
text: women at barclays earn 43.5 % less than men , according to gender pay gap figures it has submitted to the government .
only 28 of the 1,154 companies that have reported the figures have a higher median hourly pay gap than barclays .
of all financial and insurance companies that have submitted their figures , the median pay gap is 14.8 % .
barclays chief executive jes staley said it had `` more work to do '' so women could progress in financial services .
read more here .

documents.title: southern rmt strike on 12 march
text: workers on southern railway are to stage a fresh strike on 12 march in the long-running dispute over the role of guards , rmt says .

documents.title: wall street higher in early trading
text: major us stock indexes are higher in early trading after st louis fed president james bullard said policymakers would need to be careful not to raise interest rates too quickly .
hi comments came after fed minutes on wednesday showed policymakers were getting more keen on raising rates .
stocks finished lower on wednesday after concerns about rising inflation resurfaced .
the dow jones industrial average was up 0.46 % at 24,911 points , the s & p 500 was up 0.65 % at 2,71 points , and the nasdaq was up 0.28 % at 7,245 .

documents.title: ups and workhorse to build electric delivery vans
text: united parcel service ( ups ) is getting truck maker workhorse to build electric delivery vans that could replace tens of thousands of vehicles in the package delivery company 's fleet .
he two companies said the first 50 vans will have a range of 100 miles ( 160 km ) and will be delivered in 2018 .
ups recently rolled out `` smart charging '' software at a central london facility that allowed the company to nearly triple its local electric fleet to 170 delivery vans .
the smart charging technology determines when and how fast to charge vehicles .
if vehicles are not scheduled for a full route the next day , the system can opt not to fully charge them and charge other vehicles more .

documents.title: living wage workers 'will be worse off in retirement '
text: workers earning the national living wage could be left `` significantly worse off '' in their retirement as a result of the government 's pensions auto-enrolment scheme .
that 's according to accountancy body icas .
it claims it could take 48 years after retirement on a workplace pension for a living wage worker to be better off than if they had received other benefits and a state pension .
icas president sir brian souter - founder of stagecoach - called on the government to review workplace pensions to ensure a better deal for lower paid workers .
`` it ca n't be right that a policy which aims to help people in retirement could actually result in the poorest getting poorer , '' he said .

documents.title: gas meter firm blames brexit for job cuts
text: a company that makes smart meters for british gas is planning to shed 288 of 601 jobs at its factory in greater manchester because of brexit .
landis+gyr told the gmb union it could move production from stockport to romania and asia because costs have risen 20 % since the referendum in 2016 .
the union said it was `` an example of the pressures companies are facing due to brexit uncertainty '' .
a consultation on redundancies is expected to finish by the end of april .
full story here

documents.title: where 's the missing money ?
text: one interesting point that came up at the select committee grilling of carillion 's auditors earlier is that there appears to be £ 126.1m missing .
kpmg 's peter meehan was asked by mps about a disputed £ 200m bill .
carillion maintained it was owed the cash by the qataris - but the qataris claim that , in fact , it 's the other way around and they are owed the money .
when asked who owed who £ 200m , mr meehan attemtped to clear things up .
he told mps , in march [ 20 ] 17 i do n't know '' he explained that his audit responsibilities only went to the end of the previous year .
i know that my client was owed £ 73.9m as of december 2016 . ''
it remains unclear what 's happened to the outstanding £ 126.1m .

documents.title: diesel ban still up in the air
text: a federal court in germany is due to decide whether banning diesel cars from entering cities is an acceptable way to cut urban air pollution .
if it concludes that such bans would be legitimate , analysts say , then authorities across germany will come under pressure to introduce them .
carmakers could also face demands to make expensive modifications to millions of older cars , so that they meet the latest eu emissions standards .
the case was originally brought by an environmental group , which claimed not enough was being done to address poor air quality in the cities of duessledorf and stuttgart .
a lower court ruled last year that the most effective way to reduce pollution and protect public health in cities was to restrict the use of older diesels .
author: Theo Leggett
BBC Business News Reporter

this store on camden high street in north london was still closed this morning , however .
and if you want the `` inside story '' on what went wrong for kfc 's delivery , read this story from wired .

documents.title: the session has finished
text: that 's it for today 's select committee sessions on carillion .

documents.title: should accountants be broken up ?
text: frank field asks a blunt question of the auditors .
`` there 's a real question about your integrity .
there 's a little gang of you that competes for these contracts .
should we recommend in our report that the government should seriously think about breaking you all up ? ''
kpmg 's michelle hincliffe replies : `` to deliver the quality audit that we have to , we need scale .
we need to have specialist resources . ''

deloitte 's michael jones adds : `` i 've worked for deloitte 's and other firms for 30 years and been a partner for 20 and it does not feel like a cosy club when we are pitching against each other for work . ''

documents.title: it 's a tough job
text: `` i 've learned lots of lessons in the three evidence sessions we 've had already , '' says rachel reeves .
`` what have you learned , she asks peter meehan .
there 's another long pause from the kpmg man .
eventually he says : `` i suppose i learned what a tough job it is . ''

documents.title: carillion : lessons to be learned
text: rachel reeve : `` if you were in a company in the future and you saw some of the warning signs that you saw at carillion would you do anything differently ? ''
kpmg 's peter meehan says : `` um . ''
he pauses and collects his thoughts .
`` i ca n't think i would , '' he eventually responds .
the he adds : `` you 're always learning in life and there 's an investigation going on into the audit which we we will learn lessons from and i will take on board . ''

documents.title: kpmg : no 'aggressive accounting at carillion '
text: carillion has been criticised for 'aggressive accounting ' , points out ruth george .
`` is that a term you recongise in the way carillion approached its accounts ? ''
she asks the auditors .
michelle hincliffe of kpmg says : `` i certainly do n't recognise it . ''
she then quickly tries to distance herself from the mess .
`` in my role i was n't directly involved in the audit , '' she says .

documents.title: carillion auditors : 'did you challenge goodwill calculation claims ? '
text: `` did you ever challenge them about the value of goodwill they put in their accounts ? ''
rachel reeves challenged kpmg 's peter meehan .
he points to kpmg 's report and says : `` the paper outlines that we did .
they still had headroom and we concurred that they still had headroom based on the forecasts for the business . ''

documents.title: 'you did n't think this was a risk ? '
text: `` nobody makes 38,000 design changes on a project unless there is a difficult client relationship , '' said mp antoinette sandbach .
she mentioned previous evidence given by carillion 's management that they had repeatedly visited qatar trying to get the government to pay up for the 2020 fifa world cup project work .
`` and you did n't think that this was a risk that had to twist people 's arms ? ''
she asked kpmg 's peter meehan .
mr meehan argued that carillion did receive £ 40m , so kpmg did not see it as a risk .
however , ms george pointed out that the financial reporting council ( frc ) had repeatedly criticised kpmg for the way it calculates goodwill .

documents.title: 'contract costing ' : does anyone know how it works ?
text: accounting academic grahame steven writes in response to the mps grilling of carillion auditors this morning and the practice of including expected profits/losses on a contract .
he points out it 's called `` contract costing '' and helpfully includes a link to a paper he has written that highlights the subjective nature of this practice .
but he has a question for mps : `` when a contract is expected to make a loss , ias11 ( item 36 ) requires that loss - the whole loss - to 'be recognised as an expense immediately ' .
is the committee aware of ias11 ? ''
good question !
is anyone involved in the sorry business aware of ias11 ?

documents.title: 'how did you get your figures ? '
text: mp antoinette sandbach is getting serious about numbers carrillion released about the qatar contract , which kpmg 's peter meehan claims he has n't seen .
a common accounting-trick businesses use is to project how much money they are likely to make in the year ahead , and include that in the current year 's figures .
mr meehan said kpmg 's report had different , lower figures than the ones carillion released .
`` only £ 11m were incurred costs , the rest were expected earnings , so they were n't in the balance sheet yet , '' he explained .
`` yet , less than six months after this report , there was a write-off of over £ 200m .
what changed on the contract in that time ? ''
asked ms george .
mr meehan said that relations went really sour and a blockade prevented carillion from getting materials and people to the building sites in qatar .

documents.title: 'what single act did you do that might have saved this company ? '
text: mps are complaining that it seems that no-one sitting before the two select committees seems to understand why carillion went bust .
`` what single act did you do that might have saved this company ? ''
asked mp frank field .
`` i 'm not proud of where the company has ended up , no , '' replied peter meehan , partner of audit at kpmg .
`` i 'm very sorry for what 's happened to the families of the employees who lost their jobs and sub contractors and shareholders .
but my role is to be the auditor - not in the choosing of management .
`` independence does n't allow me to make decisions on behalf of the company . ''

documents.title: deloitte : 'it was n't us '
text: michael jones , internal audit partner at deloitte , has said that although the firm were carillion 's internal auditors , they were not responsible for the money .
`` we 're not the financial accountants , we do n't pull the numbers together - we look at the control environment the company has , '' he told the select committee .
`` reports we would look at would range from whether a driver in alberta had the right insurance , to the state of labour camps in qatar where they house their people .
`` we would look at a very broad range of issues carillion faced . ''

documents.title: sacked pregnant worker loses european court case
text: the eu 's top court has ruled that firms can dismiss pregnant workers as part of general staff cuts , despite legal protections for pregnant women .
the european court of justice ( ecj ) defended the position of spain 's bankia - a bank that was bailed out - over its dismissal of a pregnant woman in 2013 .
in her case , it said , the dismissal was not connected to her pregnancy , so did not infringe eu law .
full story here

documents.title: i 'm a bean counter not a beam counter , says kpmg auditor
text: mps are quizzing kpmg about why cracked beams in royal liverpool hospital were not detected .
`` who was checking these beams to make sure that they were not cracked ?
you 're there to challenge these judgments made by the management , are n't you ? ''
said mp rachel maclean .

`` it looks a situation has happened where these enormous cracked beams have gone into this hospital , costing millions of pounds , residents are waiting for the hospital to treat them and someone is n't even doing the basics to check that the basic construction is being done properly . ''
peter meehan , partner of audit at kpmg , responded that he was not an expert in construction , and that he had done his best when he visited the hospital in 2014 and 2015 .
he said his role was to record the accounts for carillion , not inspect beams .

documents.title: market update : bat and anglo american biggest losers
text: a quick look at the market : the ftse 100 remains down around 1 % today , hit by disappointing results , big stocks going ex-dividend and concerns over rising bond yields .
shares in british american tobacco were the biggest fallers , down around 4.5 % after the cigarette maker reported weaker-than-expected sales growth for 2017 .
likewise miner anglo american was down 3 % following its full year update after analysts pointed out that anglo 's had risen 16 % in 2018 ahead of the announcement ,
elsewhere mid cap moneysupermarket plummeted 18 % after its guidance disappointed investors , with the firm pointing to costs around a new strategy .

documents.title: 'people knew it had challenges '
text: peter meehan , partner of audit at kpmg says : `` people knew it had challenges , but it knew that the company would deliver . ''
he said the company first told him a write-down was required in may , and then on 10 july in a paper carillion said the write-down figure was £ 695m .
mr meehan says he discussed the figure with carillion 's management and convinced them that the figure should be higher - £ 845m .

documents.title: 'why did n't deloitte turn up to quarterly audit meetings ? '
text: deloitte were the internal auditors of carillion , and according to michael jones , internal audit partner at deloitte , the firm did not attend quarterly audit meetings .

astonishingly , mr jones confirmed that most of the news about carillion 's troubles - including a debate about whether qatar owes carillion £ 220m for 2020 fifa world cup building work - was not known by deloitte until it came into the public domain .

documents.title: passing the buck
text: michelle hinchliffe , the head of audit at kpmg ( sitting on the far right ) , has just told the select committee that although she is head of audit , any questions about details to do with the carillion investigation would be best asked of her colleague peter meehan , who is a partner of audit at kpmg .

documents.title: 'why did n't kmpg challenge carillion 's accounts ? '
text: auditors kpmg and deloitte are now being quizzed by mps about why it did not spot problems in carillion 's accounts .
peter meehan , partner of audits at kpmg , said that he made 30 site visits , including going out to qatar , and he insists that the auditors did challenge the firm .
however , mps remain unconvinced because kpmg continued to sign off on carillion 's financial results .

documents.title: carillion : amey rail saves 700 jobs
text: while mps quiz carillion auditors , there 's some good news for a few former carillion workers : amey rail says it has scooped up a major tranche of carillion 's network rail contracts safeguarding up to 700 jobs .
the transfer of network rail contracts operated by carillion construction to amey rail includes projects in the east midlands , london and north west england .

matthew steele , commercial director network rail said : this is a positive step for the industry , ensuring the delivery of a number of major rail projects across the country while safeguarding an expected 700 jobs and the wider supply chain . ''

documents.title: no going back on energy cap
text: centrica boss iain conn this morning linked the 4,000 job losses announced at the firm with the introduction of an energy price cap .
but if he thinks that will stop the government plans to go ahead with the cap , he 's sadly mistaken .

a beis spokesperson said : `` the government , the cma and the business , energy and industrial strategy select committee have all found that the energy market is not working for consumers , with households being overcharged by as much as £ 1.4bn a year .
`` the government has been clear that we will intervene to protect customers who are being overcharged for their energy until we have a market that works for consumers . ''

documents.title: pensions regulator only contacted carillion in january
text: when companies are in financial trouble , they can make a regulated apportionment arrangement ( raa ) - a restructuring mechanism that enables a firm to detach itself from its liabilities in respect of a defined pension scheme .
mps criticised the regulator for not contacting carillion for so long .

mike birch , director of case management at the pensions regulator , said that it does not advise companies to implement an raa , so it only contacted carillion in january , and for a long time , the firm `` did n't think it would happen '' .

carillion went bust on 15 january , and the pensions regulator only then began an anti-trust investigation on 18 january , in the hopes of recouping money from trustees that had made the most from the firm .

documents.title: economic growth forecast : reaction
text: chris williamson , chief business economist at ihk markit comments on estimated gdp growth in the fourth quarter of 2017 being revised down from 0.5 % to 0.4 % .
the biggest downturn in the fourth quarter was seen in the mining , oil and quarrying sector , which should be temporary , so some bounce-back should help the economy in the first quarter .
however , other areas of the economy look worryingly weak .
construction output fell 0.7 % , indicating that the building sector is technically in recession .
business investment was meanwhile flat , and household spending rose a modest 0.3 % .

documents.title: 'what would you have done if you had known ? '
text: mps are continuing to press the pensions regulator about why it did not act and ask carillion for payments to its pensions fund .
`` no , we did n't act in the particular instances of the acquisitions .
i can not answer to what we would have done in hindsight , as i am not aware of the precise set of circumstances at the time , '' said lesley titcomb , chief executive of the pensions regulator .
`` we would have had to evaluate whether there was room for litigation . ''

documents.title: 'why did n't you ask them for more money ? '
text: the pensions regulator has been asked why they were not tougher with carillion about its pensions deficit .
mps asked why the regulator did n't ask for more money during negotiations .

`` the stronger an employer is , the more able they can withstand risk in their investment strategy , and the more they are able to support risk in the pension scheme , '' answered nicola parish , executive director of frontline regulation at the pensions regulator .
`` just because they can pay more money does n't mean they have to under the regulatory framework . ''

documents.title: new year high for chinese markets
text: it 's been a good start for chinese stocks on the first day of trading after the lunar new year break .
the mainland 's benchmark shanghai composite closed 2.2 % higher , clocking its gain in a single day since august 2016 .
for the rest , asian markets showed a more mixed
japan 's nikkei 225 closed down 1.1 % while korea 's kospi wrapped the day 0.6 % lower .
in hong kong , the hang seng also lost some ground and finished down 1.3 % .
in australia , the asx 200 closed the day flat .

documents.title: moneysupermarket shares slump 24 %
text: shares in price comparison site moneysupermarket have fallen by more than 24 % after it warned of slower growth in 2018 .
it posted a 5.3 % rise in pre-tax profits to £ 96.1m for 2017 , but said earnings are expected to be `` broadly flat '' in 2018 amid a slowdown in its core markets .
the company said it expects one-off transitional costs of £ 6-9m during this year to cover reorganisation of the business .
last year the company was fined for sending seven million emails to people who had asked not to receive them .
meanwhile its 'twerking ' advert remains one of the most-complained about campaign with more than 1,000 people taking offence .

documents.title: is it just like bhs ?
text: the pensions regulator is being quizzed by two parliament select committees about why it failed to notice the problems with carillion sooner .
the regulator said that some of its powers - such as section 231 of the companies act - were difficult to use , and sometimes it threatened the use of a power in order to get companies to play ball .
it vehemently denied that the carillion crisis is similar to the bankruptcy of bhs , saying that it noticed the problems much faster than with bhs .
`` we need to be clearer , quicker and tougher , '' said lesley titcomb , chief executive of the pensions regulator .
`` [ if we had known sooner about carillion ] , i think we would not have continued with the negotiations , we would have used our powers quicker . ''

documents.title: breakinguk economic growth revised down
text: the office for national statistics ( ons ) has released british gdp figures that show the economy grew less than previously thought in the final three months of 2017 .
the british economy grew by 0.4 % between october and december , which is below the preliminary estimate of 0.5 % .
looking at gdp year-on-year , the revised growth of 1.4 % was the weakest it had been in over half a decade .
`` a number of very small revisions to mining , energy generation and service were enough to see a slight downward revision to quarterly growth overall , '' said ons statistician darren morgan .

documents.title: the problems with nationalisation
text: recently , there have been increasing calls by the labour party to nationalise more public services , but experts say it is n't that simple .
dan neidle , partner at law firm clifford chance , told today that court cases over how much compensation shareholders should receive when the government takes over often last for years .
he did not agree with shadow chancellor john mcdonnell 's claim that privatisation would `` cost nothing '' .
`` government can not take your house or your pension fund without giving compensation .
article 1 of the european convention of human rights gives you a right to peaceful enjoyment of property , '' he explained .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

the brexit sub-committee is meeting to spell out in detail what it wants to secure from brexit talks .
the brexit sub committee includes key figures like foreign secretary boris johnson and chancellor philip hammond .

documents.title: centrica pushed on 4,000 jobs cut
text: british gas owner centrica is yet to divulge where the 4,000 job losses it plans by 2020 will strike .
it says `` a small majority are expected to be in our uk operations '' .
that presumably means more than 2,000 uk jobs will disappear .
`` thousands of uk jobs are at stake , in areas of the country where decent employment can be hard to find , '' pointed out unison 's matt lay .

documents.title: british gas 'should n't put squeeze on staff and customers '
text: the union unison says that british gas staff will be `` devastated '' to hear about 4,000 more job losses at the energy supplier .
british gas ' results showed that it had lost 750,000 customers , with 1.4 million accounts closed in 2017 .
british gas ca n't go on putting the squeeze on its staff and customers .

if the company is to survive , it needs first class products , priced competitively to help rebuild its market share , and a genuine strategy for growth , '' said matt lay , unison 's national energy officer .
`` without this , thousands of uk jobs are at stake , in areas of the country where decent employment can be hard to find . ''

documents.title: positive news for bae systems and no more job cuts
text: bae systems has reported a 8 % rise in earnings .
the pension deficit is down .
the defence spend outlook in several countries is looking good .
the news flow for bae systems is largely positive these days .
the biggest tailwind for them is the political climate in the us .
the pentagon is already bae 's biggest customer .
we all know how trump feels about having beautiful toys at his disposal .
in fact , we 're expecting the us to increase its defence spending .
the middle east is a bit of a mixed bag because of the escalation between qatar & saudi arabia .
saudi accounts for about 20 % of overall sales .
its been holding off signing a contract as the ink was yet to dry on a contract with qatar for typhoons .
yesterday the uk defence secretary announced plans to preserve the uk 's ability to design and develop fighter jets .
a new combat air strategy will outline how britain intends to maintain its expertise in making military aircraft once the production of typhoon fighter jets ends .
the strategy will be published in the summer .
last october the company announced it would cut almost 2,000 jobs .
author: Victoria Fritz
BBC transport correspondent

documents.title: barclays 'spinning too many plates '
text: richard hunter , head of markets at interactive investor , reckons barclays remains a hold
barclays is spinning many plates at the moment , and inevitably there are some breakages .
its exit from the african business has been costly , litigation and conduct fines remain a financial thorn in the side , while the investment bank had a difficult end to the year .
it remains a jam tomorrow '' stock and the general market consensus of the shares as a hold is unlikely to be upgraded for the moment

documents.title: carillion fallout : barclays loses £ 127m
text: barclays bosses have confirmed that a £ 127m charge taken in its fourth quarter largely related to failed outsourcing giant carillion , which collapsed into liquidation last month .
a raft of british banks were exposed to carillion through unpaid loans .

documents.title: profits double at anglo american
text: miner anglo american is paying its biggest dividend in a decade - 54 cents a share - after halving its net debt to $ 4.5bn ( £ 3.24bn ) .
pre-tax profits doubled to $ 5.5bn ( £ 3.96bn ) .
chief executive mark cutifani said a `` 28pc productivity improvement '' in 2017 had helped the company 's bottom line , alongside rising prices for its products .
`` we exceeded our cost and volume improvement target for the year , '' he added .

documents.title: heathrow reports record results , but a fall in profits
text: heathrow has reported record financial results but posted a fall in pre-tax profits .
revenues were £ 2,9bn , up 2.7 % on the year before , but pre-tax profits fell 18.7 % from £ 267m in 2016 to £ 217m in 2017 .
the number of customers passed through the airport grew 3.1 % to 78 million .
heathrow said significant progress had been made towards expanding the airport , including the government agreeing to a parliament vote and a progression in discussions on expansion regulations .
chief executive john holland-kaye said : `` the government needs to crack on with heathrow expansion as quickly as possible with a vote in parliament before the summer . ''

documents.title: ftse drops on opening
text: the ftse 100 dropped 0.67 % to 7,232.86 when it opened this morning .
that was a fall of 48.71 points .
yesterday it ended positively climbing 0.48 % , or 34.8 points , by the close of trading .

documents.title: carillion auditors to face mps grilling
text: the auditors of carillion will be quizzed by mps this morning over their role in the collapse of the construction giant .
two select committees will also question carillion 's internal auditors deloitte and the pensions regulator as part of a joint inquiry into the crisis .
the work and pensions , and business committees said they had a `` growing pile of evidence '' that those involved with carillion , including investors and hedge funds , saw warnings of its demise .
`` so why did n't the auditors ?
how did kpmg sign off accounts that had £ 845 million written off their value four months later ? ''
kpmg is already facing an investigation by the financial reporting council .

documents.title: british gas owner to cut 4,000 jobs
text: centrica , which owns british gas , is cutting 4,000 jobs by 2020 as it continues to lose customers .
chief executive iain conn , blamed uk regulatory intervention , for what he said was a `` weak '' second half of 2017 .
british gas lost 750,000 customers in the year , leaving it still the largest uk energy supplier with 7.8 million customers .

documents.title: serco profits drop 29 % as boss calls for 'more balance '
text: profits at public services outsourcing firm serco fell 29 % to £ 69.8m last year .
the company said : `` the uk market for public service outsourcing is afflicted by well-publicised traumas '' .
rupert soames , chief executive , told today that after the carillion collapse the way suppliers and the uk government deal with each other must change .

he said that taxpayers are in the middle and deserve `` world-class services '' , but there is n't enough publicly-available information about how government-provided services and privately-provided services perform .
`` you 're taking the risk of what government wants to do .
we need to have a more balanced relationship between supppliers and government , because [ the public services industry ] employs 1.2 million people in the uk , '' he told today .
`` there was one case where we were two to three days late to repair a boiler for a flat , and the price of the penalty was more than the flat could be bought for . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: profits climb 10 % at barclays
text: banking giant barclays has posted a 10 % rise in annual pre-tax profits to £ 3.54bn , up from £ 3.23bn in 2016 .
but it was forced to set aside £ 1.2bn for legal bills and fines , including £ 700m for ppi .
but the bank said that there were no new charges for the mis-selling scandal .
jes staley , group chief executive , said : `` 2017 was a year of considerable strategic progress for barclays .
we have already started to see some of the benefits of our work in 2017 . ''

documents.title: bae systems lifted by f-35s and laser rockets
text: bae systems has reported positive full-year figures , boosted by new orders for f-35 fighter jets and typhoon aircraft , as well as growing demand for its laser-guided rockets .
group sales increased by £ 0.6bn to £ 19.6bn , compared to 2016 , while revenue came in at £ 18.3bn , compared to £ 17.8bn in the year before .
however , operating profit decreased to £ 1.5bn , including a £ 384m non-cash goodwill impairment in its cyber-security division applied intelligence , which made a £ 61m loss .
bae systems said that sales growth is expected in 2018 from electronic warfare contracts , combat vehicles and weapons systems , while cyber-security and intelligence services will break even .

documents.title: british gas loses 1.4m customer accounts as profits slump 17 % at centrica
text: profits at british gas owner centrica fell 17 % to £ 1.25bn last year .
the company lost 10 % of its uk energy customers in the year , accounts falling from 14.25 million to 12.87 million .
the figures were hit by `` poor performance in business energy supply and particularly in our north america business unit , '' said iain conn , chief executive .
he said : `` concerns over the loss of energy customers in the uk , and the performance issue in north america have created material uncertainty around centrica . ''
he added : `` we regret this deeply '' .
the proposed full-year dividend is 12p .

documents.title: government must rethink supplier relationships to avoid another carillion
text: rupert soames , group chief executive of serco says `` all is not right in the market for government services '' and that `` there is an urgent need to re-think the relationship between the uk government and its suppliers '' .
what 's gone wrong ?

he says the `` government has used its position as a monopoly buyer to push companies , large and small , into accepting contractual terms and risks that they could not conceivably manage or hedge . ''

he says the balance of power in the market shifted to the government around 2010 when `` government started to hire poachers and made them its gamekeepers '' forcing companies to become more competitive .
but as margins fell suppliers struggled , including serco .
`` in 2014 , we had to take £ 447m of onerous contract provisions to reflect the cost of contractual commitments we had made , '' he says .
`` since then , few suppliers in the sector have escaped unscathed , but carillion is the first major bankruptcy . ''

documents.title: ford executive steps down over 'behaviour '
text: the north american president at motoring giant ford has stepped down after an internal investigation found his behaviour fell short of the company 's code of conduct .

raj nair , president of ford north america since last july , said : i sincerely regret that there have been instances where i have not exhibited leadership behaviours with the principles that the company and i have always espoused . ''
ford did not specify details of the investigation 's findings .
we made this decision after a thorough review and careful consideration , '' said ford chief executive jim hackett .
ford is deeply committed to providing and nurturing a safe and respectful culture and we expect our leaders to fully uphold these values . ''

documents.title: water firms 'need to be more transparent '
text: uk water regulator ofwat was questioned on bbc radio 4 's today programme about why it has n't come down more harshly on privatised water companies over leaks and high prices .
a study by the university of greenwich found the companies had earned about £ 18bn in pre-tax profits over the past decade , and paid out about the same amount in shareholders .
rachel fletcher , the chief executive of ofwat , said that the regulator is calling for companies to be more transparent about their financial statements .
`` we 've seen key improvements over the last few years , while keeping costs flat for customers in real terms , '' she told today .
`` we 're pushing companies to be transparent about where customers ' money is going and how much of it is in dividends .
i think when that information comes into the public domain , it 's a chance for companies to say - is that a we 're happy with ? ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: barclays : still suffering from 'sins of the past '
text: we 're mid-way through the bank reporting season so mike amey , managing director , pimco has been looking ahead to barclays ' figures due to today .
he told wake up to money : `` the basic theme of the uk banking industry is that their profits are pretty healthy .
they 've restructured their banks .
they 've got very high capital ratios so they 're actually in pretty good nick .
there 's just the question of when their earnings will be fully cleared up from the payments from the sins of the past and that 's what people will be looking for .
with barclays today that 's ppi and whether they 've suffered in the us . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
Wake Up To Money

documents.title: chinese mainland markets return to trade
text: markets on mainland china were trading for the first time on thursday following the week-long lunar new year holiday .
the shanghai composite welcomed the start of the new year in high spirits .
the index opened in positive territory after the break and was still up by more than 2 % in the afternoon session .
the shanghai shenzhen csi 300 index was also up by more than 2 % .
the benchmark hang seng in hong kong also opened higher , but by mid afternoon was following wall street 's lead and was in negative territory , down by nearly 1 % .
japan 's nikkie 225 also dropped lower , finishing the day down 1.07 % to 21,736.44 points .
